question: Correct. Naked force has settled more issues in history than any other factor. The contrary opinion 'violence never solves anything' is wishful thinking at its worst. People who forget that always pay... They pay with their lives and their freedom. You. Tell me the moral difference, if any, between the citizen and the civilian ?
answer: The difference lies in the field of civic virtue. A citizen accepts personal responsibility for the safety of the body politic, of which he is a member, defending it, if need be, with his life. The civilian does not.

question: The exact words of the text. But do you understand it ? Do you believe it ?
answer: Uh, I don't know.

question: C'mon, let's see if they've posted the math final test yet.
answer: How should I know ?

question: First thing Fleet Academy looks at is your math scores. Wish me luck !
answer: Good for you.

question: You still haven't kissed her yet ? Don't lie.
answer: What's the hurry ?

question: Others are waiting.
answer: Did you read her mind ?

question: Don't have to... Some mating semaphore is pretty hard to miss.
answer: Yeah, but I want Carmen.

question: She's flying starships !
answer: Who ?

question: Marco's sister. Can you imagine maneuvering half a million tons through crwoded space lanes... You gotta have nerves of steel ! Reflexes are critical
answer: I have good reflexes.

question: Well, if that's the crop, that must be the gastric caecal...
answer: Excuse me...!

question: 35% on the math final ! No one could be that dumb with numbers.
answer: Well, at least you didn't lose your lunch over a bug. How embarassing.

question: Who cares about bugs ? You can't go anywhere if you don't know math.
answer: Don't be so sure. I like you even if you are dumb with numbers.

question: Then how come you won't hold hands with me at school ?
answer: I don't want everyone to see.

question: Why won't you kiss me when we're all alone ?
answer: How come that's all you talk about anymore ?

question: It's all I think about anymore.
answer: You can't walk me home.

question: Why not ?
answer: I thought you were going to help Carl.

question: Carl can wait.
answer: Johnny, my Dad's home today.

question: What's he got against me... I mean, I 'm a teenager. You can't be a citizen when you're only a teenager !
answer: It's not you, Johnny. Your parents are rich they don't need to be citizens, and that stuff means a lot to my dad. He's a veteran.

question: Well, if your dad doesn't like me, how come we're such good friends ?
answer: Sometimes I do what I want, eh ?

question: Don't think about it... go on instinct.
answer: Ace of spades.

question: Statistically speaking you should've accidentally guessed right by know.
answer: In addition to "psychic dolt" this test also proves I'm unlucky ? Two of hearts.

question: Luck is not a factor. No one really knows why some people are sensitive and some aren't. Federal studies like this might provide a clue.
answer: I wouldn't want to know what everyone was thinking. Four of spades.

question: Cyrano, you big yellow turd !
answer: He just wants attention. You don't play with him like you used to.

question: Go bug Mom, Cyrano.
answer: How do you make him do that ?

question: I gave him the impression that there was a fly crawling up my mom's leg. He is going to go eat it.
answer: Carl, promise me you won't ever do anything like that to me.

question: Don't be afraid. Can't do humans... yet. C'mon let's go.
answer: Ten of clubs. You still gonna sign up for Starside R&D ?

question: Passport to the Universe. Who wouldn't want that ?
answer: I've been thinking about applying for Federal Service, too. Fleet, maybe.

question: Your father will never let you.
answer: I'm eighteen. It's my decision, I think I'd make a pretty good pilot. I've good great reflexes. You need that for maneuvering, you know.

question: Only 1 in 14 male applicants make it through stellar navigation. So what do you think your chances are ?
answer: Eight point... no, uh, seven...

question: If you can't do those numbers, you haven't got a chance.
answer: All I know is Carmen's going to be a citizen, and I don't think it'll work out for us if I'm not.

question: Love... how excruciatingly pathetic. Now try and pay attention.
answer: Queen of hearts.

question: Are you alright ?
answer: I'm getting better. So what are you doing later ?

question: Everyone is going to the dance. Aren't you ?
answer: I don't know. It's my last night as acivilian. I ship out for Tereshkova tomorrow.

question: You're going to the Academy ? That's where I want to go. I'd love to talk to you abou that.
answer: I'm all ears.

question: WATCH THE BLITZ...! Flip six, three hole. Rico ? Hey !
answer: What ?

question: You were drifting. Flip six, three hole. On one, got it ?
answer: Just throw me the ball, Diz.

question: Who gave you this idea ? It's that teacher. What's his name ? You know the one I mean.
answer: Mr. Rasczak.

question: Rasczak... Silly name. There ought to be a law against using a school as a recruiting station !
answer: No, Mr. Rasczak doesn't do that at all. He sorta discourages you really.

question: Good, because you're going to Harvard, and that's the end of it.
answer: I'm eighteen. It's my decision.

question: Hey, Rico, wanna dance ?
answer: Actually, Diz, I promised Carmen...

question: Too bad for her if she's not around. You know, it's sad... Most of us probably won't see each other again after tonight.
answer: You still gonna play for Brazil ?

question: Looks like, unless Tokyo lets me start.
answer: Well, anyone who gets you is lucky.

question: How come we never got together ?
answer: Can't we just be friends, Diz ?

question: Sure.
answer: Uh, look, Diz...

question: Guess you gotta go.
answer: You're the best. Isn't it great to be in love ?

question: Mister Rasczak ?
answer: What is it, Rico ?

question: I just wanted to say thanks 'cause History and Moral Philosophy was the best class I had this year.
answer: Well, it's not really my job to please. Hope you learned something.

question: I wanna join up, Mr. Rasczak. I think I have what it take to be a citizen.
answer: Good for you. Go find out.

question: Well, my parents are against it, and I know it's my choice, but I was wondering... What would you do if you were me ?
answer: Figuring things out for yourself is the only freedom anyone really has. Use that freedom. Make your own choice, Rico.

question: He just got accepted to the Fleet Academy. Isn't that great ?
answer: Yeah, sure, I guess.

question: No, I mean if he can get in, maybe I have a chance.
answer: What are you talking about ? We both know you're gonna be a pilot.

question: Zander is going for pilot, too.
answer: You two have so much in common.

question: Johnny Rico, you're jealous !
answer: I can't help it.

question: He's nothing like you.
answer: I don't even know if you're my girl.

question: Are you the boy for me ?
answer: I'm gonna do it, Carmen. I'm gonna sign up for Federal Service.

question: Oh, Johnny... Everyone's looking... we shouldn't...
answer: Who cares ?

question: You're right. Let's never stop...
answer: I love you, Carmen.

question: Shhh... Sorry, Dad. See you, Johnny.
answer: Maybe Carmen's gonna make her own decisions from now on, Mr. Ibanez.

question: Here in Buenos Aires. No, sir. Courage, I guess. I want to be a citizen because... well, because of my girl, sir.
answer: I'm happy to tell you that you've been accepted for Federal Service.

question: Wow, that's great.
answer: Looks like you're quite an athlete. Boy, look at those reaction stats. My job is to dertermine what you're best suited for.

question: I want to be a pilot, sir.
answer: Sorry, son, no way. Your school records say you don't have the math skills. That rules out the scientific and engineering applications, and I'm afraid we reserve non-military options for candidates who are frankly less able-bodied than you are, son... It looks like the only thing you're good for is cannon fodder. I'm putting you down for the Mobile Infantery.

question: Shhh ! Don't make him feel worse.
answer: They put me out front to discourage the weak-hearted, but at the end of the day I go home. How'd you kids do ?

question: I'm gonna go for pilot.
answer: Good for you. We need every pilot we can get.

question: My father's probably gonna kill me.
answer: You'll resign, and that's all there is to it. It might look bad, but if that's the worst you suffer...

question: I won't quit !
answer: I'm telling you, you will ! You're not going back. You're going to go on vacation !

question: I'm not going on vacation ! I want to be acitizen ! It's my decision. I made it.
answer: You walk out that door, you're cut off, young man... You understand me ? Alright, THAT'S IT, YOU'RE... ...CUT OFF !

question: Don't talk about my girl that way. You're late.
answer: My Dad had to help me pack. Suddenly he's afraid he's never gonna see me again or something. It was sweet, but it took forever. Anyway, I guess I'm ready to go.

question: Me, too. I'm wearing everything I own.
answer: Poor boy. I'm sorry your parents were so mad.

question: Who cares ! The Federation'll give me everything I need for the next two years, right ?
answer: You talk to Carl ?

question: He left this morning. He couldn't say where.
answer: It's exciting, but it's scary, too isn't it. Going someplace new where you don't know anyone.

question: I'm gonna miss you.
answer: I'll miss you, too, Johnny.

question: I love you.
answer: Oh, that's me.

question: Com'on, just say it. Try it on for size.
answer: Alright, I love you.

question: Do you mean it ?
answer: I said it. Isn't that enough ? Don't forget to write !

question: The problem with you is that none of you are good enough the way you are. I am your senior drill instructor, Career Sergeant Zim. Do you think I'm funny ? Do I make you laugh ? Do you think I'm a comedian ?
answer: Sorry...!

question: The first and last words out of your stinking holes will be "sir". Do you get me ?
answer: Sir, sorry...sir.

question: See the armory ? Run around it !
answer: YEOW !

question: RUN, I SAID. Bronski, keep pace ! You are now all brothers and sisters in the same family, my family, the Mobile Infantery. I will be your mother. I will be your father. If you do not please me I will throw you out of my family because I hate all slackers and negative hackers. Do you get me ?
answer: Sir, yes, sir !

question: Anytime you think I'm being to tough, anytime you think I'm being unfair... QUIT ! Grab your gear and take a stroll down "Washout Lane". Get me ?
answer: Sir, yes, sir !

question: I wonder if there's a handful of guts in the whole bunch. Who thinks they've got what it takes to knock me down ?
answer: Sir, I guess maybe I do, sir.

question: You alright, Breckinridge ?
answer: Sir, yes, sir. It's my arm. I think it's broken, sir.

question: He'll have to get past me.
answer: MEDIC ! Some of you may not make it. WHY IS THAT WEAPON ON THE GROUND ? You might think I am unfair. Is that all you got ? You hit like kitten, Smith ! This is a punch. You will not like me. But if you survive you will thank me because you will be born again hard. You will be a new person. You will be a Cap Trooper. And then, MAYBE, you'll be good enough... ...to serve in my family.

question: Sir, I don't understands who needs a knife in a nuke fight anyway... All you gotta do is push a button, sir !
answer: Put your hand on the post, private.

question: AWK !
answer: The enemy cannot push a button if you disable his hand. MEDIC !

question: The enemy cannot push a button if you disable his hand. MEDIC !
answer: Sir, recruit Flores, reporting for duty , sir.

question: I see you specifically requested transfer from Fort Cronkite to this training group...
answer: Sir, I heard it was the best, sir !

question: At ease, soldier. It's all the same muck.
answer: Better get in line like everyone else, Ace.

question: You got some guts for a rich kid. I guess you and me could be buddies.
answer: What an honor...

question: Hey, amigo, come chow with me.
answer: No thanks, Diz.

question: What's your malfunction, Rico ?
answer: You are. I joined up to get out on my own. And you had to tag along.

question: What ? You think I joined the Mobile Infantery because of you ?
answer: You saying you didn't ?

question: You saying you didn't ?
answer: What makes you think... you'll make... squad leader, Rico ?

question: Something... I've got...you don't.
answer: You rich kids... are all the same !

question: Yes, ma'am. In simulation, my supervisors could never keep up.
answer: This isn't simulation anymore. Take'er out easy, cadet.

question: Oh, yes, sir. Vector ?
answer: Twenty-five by five, roll seven. And don't exceed port speed.

question: Or...?
answer: They revoke our flight status.

question: Man, they're defended... no way in.
answer: Flip six, three hole.

question: What ?
answer: High school... remember ? Run a flip six, three hole play, and you might score...

question: Cover me.
answer: You got it.

question: Thanks, pal.
answer: Kid's got some moves... Smith, GO ! McIntire, GO ! Flores, GO ! Rico, I'm making you sqaud leader !

question: Sir, thank you, sir !
answer: Don't stand there dumb... GO !

question: Funny how they always want to be your friends after they kick your guts out.
answer: It's what I deserve.

question: Whad'ya talkin about ?
answer: I joined up for her. I wouldn't even be here if it wasn't for her. I'm a fool.

question: You made squad leader on your own, and, hey, you still got me to kick around.
answer: Thanks, Ace.

question: Thanks. You read my mind. Third watch always seems to last forever.
answer: Oh, I don't know... Depends on who you are spending it with. Profile's wrong... there.

question: No, I replotted the course. It's more efficient this way.
answer: Three weeks aboard a starship and you know it all, huh ?

question: Hey, check it.
answer: You know I was talking to Captain, Deladier, and she said...

question: Don't change the subject. Am I right ?
answer: Well, whad'ya know...

question: Don't mess with the boss. So what'd the captain say ?
answer: She got a command... and she thinks we oughta team up officially and crew for her. She thinks we're good together.

question: You and me, huh ?
answer: I have a feeling about us. We're good together, way ahead of the curve in every department. I seem to be able to anticipate your needs. You know what I want...

question: No, what do you want ? I want to be part of the best flight team in the Fleet...
answer: Me, too... Day and Night-Cycle.

question: In this part of the system ?
answer: Sweet Jesus...!

question: Where'd it come from ?
answer: Trajectory indicates it came out of the Arachnid Quarantine Zone.

question: Don't talk like that. Get yourself home as fast as you can.
answer: We'll all have dinner. I'll fix your favorite.

question: Yeah ! We'll talk it out and have a good glass of wine ... and... well, we love you, son.
answer: Oh, my, what's that ?

question: Looks like rain.
answer: This time of the year...?

question: Well, see ya.
answer: You take the stroll down Washout Lane, you're only proving one thing, Johnny.

question: What's that, Diz ?
answer: That you don't have what it takes to be acitizen !

question: I'm serious, sir. I'll go anywhere. I want combat. Yes, sir, I get you.
answer: Sir, I wish to reconsider my request to drop out, sir. Sir, i know it was wrong. I didn't learn from one mistake and I made another, sir. Sir, my family... my whole family was in Buenos Aires, sir.

question: Is that your signature, Rico ?
answer: Sir, yes it is, sir.

question: Hey Johnny ! Johnny Rico !
answer: Carmen... ?

question: Oh... at ease. Guess I oughta lose the hat when I'm off duty, eh ?
answer: What happened to your hair ?

question: What do you think ? Everyone did it when we got our wings. You don't like it, do you ?
answer: It's alright, I guess. You hear from anyone made it out of B.A. alive ?

question: It's funny. Sometimes I forget. Then it hits me, and I can't stop crying.
answer: I try just to be happy I'm still alive.

question: You don't look very happy to see me.
answer: Should I be ?

question: Forget it, Carmen. The Mobile Infantery does a thankless, dirty job, so they naturally tend to be short-tempered, thoughtless and rude.
answer: You got something to say about the Mobile Infantery ?

question: You heard me. Wanna make something out of it, private ?
answer: Not with an officer, no, sir. The M.I. doesn't mint stupid cap troopers.

question: Bug Batteries... According to Military Intelligence, it'll be random and light. Drop status ?
answer: Drop is 35% complete, ma'am.

question: Steady as she goes, Number 1. This isn't random or light. Someone made amistake...!
answer: That's it, we're empty ma'am !

question: Ticonderoga, this is Rodger Young requesting approach vector... stare at the BATTLE-SCARED STARSHIPS and BURNT-OUT HULKS that line the docks of Ticonderoga. You know, we're lucky to be alive.
answer: Give me hand, willya ? I was thinking. Maybe we should get married, Carmen.

question: You weren't thinking...you were dreaming !
answer: If we're gonna be a team, why not be a real team ?

question: There's a war on. I want a command, I want my own ship, you do, too...
answer: So ?

question: So who's got time to get married ?
answer: Fleet encourages marriages among flight officers. You'd probably get a promotion out of it.

question: Funny...
answer: I'm not kidding. Marriage is -

question: No, funny there's almost no wounded at all.
answer: Hey, bugs don't take prisoners.

question: Oh no.
answer: Carmen...?

question: Excuse me...!
answer: I'm sorry, Carmen.

question: Please, I... Everybody's lost someone by now. This shouldn't be any different... No, I... Oh, Zander, I'm a fool.
answer: You're upset, that's alright.

question: Fire in the hole !
answer: You new guys over there... WE could use some help...

question: Looks like you've got a little bug problem, ma'am...
answer: Stow it, trooper. Give it verything you've got !

question: WATCH OUT !
answer: AAAAAAAAAAAAA !

question: Sir, look !
answer: We must be right over the colony. Let's get some air support, eh ?

question: Yes, sir ! Fleet, this is Roughneck patrol, over ...?
answer: Corporal, I want pulse cannons there and there ! Rifle teams, spread out along the ridge ! Sugar, bring up that flame thrower !

question: Fleet's pulling the battle group back to safe distance... They'd like us to knock out those batteries, sir.
answer: They'd rather spend our lives than risk their ships. Who's got the nuke ?

question: They'd rather spend our lives than risk their ships. Who's got the nuke ?
answer: That'd be me, sir.

question: Heat it up. Roughnecks, you may fire at will.
answer: I'm hot, sir !

question: C'mon...
answer: Nah, I don't do that anymore...

question: You used to dance...
answer: I said no. Want me to pull rank ?

question: They get in your mind... they make you do things ! Look here... They did it to Farley...!
answer: The distress call... The bugs wanted us to rescue you...!

question: Oh, you can be sure of it ! They were biding their time... waiting for the most opportune moment !
answer: To all Roughnecks, this is Rasczak. Prepare for attack. Repeat. We are going to be attacked...!

question: What's going on, Diz ?
answer: I got power ! Gimme a minute !

question: We don't have a minute !
answer: What frequency ?

question: All bands.
answer: Roughneck patrol to battle group... Roughneck patrol to battle group...

question: Make every shot count ! Sergeant, secure the boat !
answer: Yes, sir !

question: Board the wounded ! Move to retrieval on my command ! First group, now...! Alright, Flores ! Levy ! Rico...! AAAAAAAAAAAA !
answer: Cover us, Ace ! Hit your jets, sir !

question: I can't My legs are gone... Get on the boat... Rico, tell'em to glass this goddam planet. I've never seen so many bugs upstairs at the same time...
answer: We're not leaving you here, sir !

question: This is my farm. Get on the boat, NOW ! That's an order, Sergeant.
answer: Give'em hell, sir !

question: AAAAAAA ! GET IT OFF ME
answer: Hang on, Diz... don't die on me...

question: I bought the farm, didn't I, Johnny ?
answer: No, you're gonna be alright, Diz !

question: It's alright 'cause I got to have you, Johnny...
answer: Get on the com and tell Fleet to glass that rock...!

question: This would be mine, sir. Acting Sergeant John Rico. I've assumed command on this mission.
answer: Johnny...! I thought you were dead !

question: I'm not, but alot of my soldiers are. Glass the planet !
answer: Rodger Young, this is inbound shuttle De Ruyter with an official request from the Mobile Infantery to bombard Planet P-11... Negative on your request. Fleet Command has the battle group on standby... ...I'm sorry.

question: We gotta choke on the mud and the blood and Fleet can't be bothered to spit.
answer: No, I think something's up. The Sky Marshall's here. I thought you were KIA, Johnny...

question: That was just a mix up.
answer: You look so... I don't know, you look like you've really been in it.

question: What happened to your eye ?
answer: Almost got knocked out of the sky over Big K.

question: Where are you going ?
answer: A funeral.

question: That girl who died on the way up ...his girl ?
answer: Yeah.

question: How do you feel about him now ?
answer: I don't know, Zander.

question: A colony has to reach a certain size before it produces a Brain... we think 300 generations. Woulda too expensive to launch an operation if there wasn't a Brain... You don't approve. Well, too bad. We're in this for the species, boys and girls. It's simple numbers, they have more, and everyday I have to make decisions that send hundreds of people like you to their deaths.
answer: Didn't they tell you, Colonel ? That's what cap troopres are good for.

question: Hope you're ready for more. We're going back to P to capture that Brain.
answer: The Roughnecks are always ready, sir.

question: I hear they need a new Lieutenant... Want the job ?
answer: I'll take it... until I get killed or you find someone better.

question: Who're all these kids ?
answer: We got reinforced. Most of'em just got outa boot...

question: We're the old men, Ace. We'll take this high ground. Lookouts there and therte and up there. If the bugs come upstairs in this neighbor-hood, we'll be the first to know.
answer: Got it. Fleet tactical wants to know where they can deploy the skimmers.

question: Down there on the flats, eh ? Listen up, Roughnecks ! Our primary objective is to assist our friends from the Fleet... Alright, cut it out. We will deploy from skimmers in teams of six. If the bugs open up a battery, we put it out of business. Any questions ? Would'ya mind moving your boat ? You're standing on my H.Q., Lieutenant !
answer: This is a Fleet-driven operation, son, and the Fleet thinks my boat will be safer on the high ground. You can have everything else, eh ?

question: You heard the Sky Marshall... Move it all down -
answer: Rodger Young, prepare to receice outgoing fire...! I'll take the first group.

question: Any survivors ?
answer: This is Lieutenant Carmen Ibanez. Is anyone receiving ?

question: Affirmative ! Carmen, this is Roughneck base camp... What is your present location ?
answer: My present location is 42 degrees South by 176 degrees East... situation is extremely hostile... I...AAAAAAAAA ! AAAAAAAAAAAAAA !

question: We're outa here. Lieutenant, get your men into the skimmers. This real estate's about to go buggy.
answer: Hey, just calm down, I'm giving the orders here-

question: Form a perimeter ! Make yourself useful, fly boy... PREPARE TO REPEL BUGS !
answer: AAAAAAAAAAA !

question: Ace, get on the com. Tell Fleet we need retrieval... Sugar, salvage some armor and suit up Lieutenant Barcalow.
answer: Thanks.

question: What do you think you're doing ?
answer: I'm gonna save Carmen.

question: That would mean a comlete disregard for the mission objective. They hang you for that, Rico.
answer: Yeah, that's right.

question: Let's go.
answer: Move out.

question: Up. We gotta be near A Company by now. FALL BACK ! How bad are you, pal ?
answer: Been better, buddy.

question: Alright, we're gonna carry you...
answer: Nah, I figureyou folks oughta get upstairs before it's too late... Gimmee the nuke.

question: Don't be a hero...
answer: This is my farm. Now c'mon, give me what you got and get out of here...
